name: Commemoration of the Great Fire of Hamburg
reverse: Detailed overhead map of the part of Hamburg, Germany destroyed by fires. The arrows denote the direction of the currents of the river Elbe.
reverse_inscriptions: DAS DURCH FEUER ZERSTOERTE HAMBURG DEIT 5 BIS 8 MAI 1842
description: The Great fire of Hamburg began early on May 5, 1842 in Deichstraße and burned until the morning of May 8, destroying about one third of the buildings in the Altstadt.
